intro: Strobilanthes sulfurea, commonly known as the golden flame plant, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories and thrives in tropical climates. Its flowers are clustered in dense spikes and are highly attractive to pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
